instructions: Rinse and drain the lentils.
Dice the onion, cut the carrot and potato into small cubes.
Heat the vegetable oil in a pot, add the chopped onion and sauté until golden brown.
Add the carrot and potato, sauté for a few more minutes.
Add the lentils, pour in the water, and bring to a boil.
Once boiling, reduce the heat, cover the pot, and simmer until the lentils are tender.
Blend the soup, add salt and spices.
Serve with lemon juice.
servingSuggestion: Lentil soup can be served with fresh bread.

ingredients: Salt and black pepper, to taste
instructions: Cook the spaghetti according to package instructions.
In a pan, sauté finely chopped onion and crushed garlic until softened.
Add the minced meat and cook until browned.
Add crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper.
Simmer the sauce for 20-30 minutes until it thickens.
Serve with cooked spaghetti, sprinkle with grated parmesan cheese on top.
Enjoy your Spaghetti Bolognese!
servingSuggestion: Spaghetti Bolognese can be served with garlic bread or a green salad.

instructions: Heat a pan over medium heat and cook the chicken in vegetable oil until browned.
Remove the chicken from the pan and heat sesame oil in the same pan.
Add diced bell peppers, carrot, broccoli, and crushed garlic, and sauté until slightly tender.
Once the vegetables are soft, add the chicken back to the pan.
Add soy sauce and honey, stir and cook for a few more minutes.
Serve hot, garnish with sesame seeds if desired.
servingSuggestion: Serve hot, can be served with rice or noodles.

instructions: Sauté the spinach in vegetable oil, add salt and pepper.
Once the spinach has cooled, add crumbled white cheese and mix well.
Spread the phyllo dough on a surface, brush with milk and egg mixture.
Fill with the spinach and cheese mixture and roll it up.
Place the prepared pastries on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.
Bake in a preheated 180°C oven until golden brown on top.
Serve warm or hot.
Sauté the onion and garlic in olive oil until softened.
Add diced zucchinis and sauté for a few more minutes.
Add the vegetable broth and bring to a boil, simmer until the zucchinis are tender.
Blend the soup, add yogurt and mix well.
Season with salt and pepper.
Serve hot, drizzle with a few drops of olive oil on top.
